A BIG SPENDER.Definition: someone who spends a lot of money

A DROP IN THE OCEAN.Definition: very small compared to something else

ADEQUATELY.Definition: in a way that is enough

ALLEGEDLY.Definition: used to say that people say something is true, without providing proof

AT LARGE.Definition: escaped, and the authorities do not know where they are

BRAZEN.Definition: obvious and without trying to hide

BRIBE.Definition: to try to make someone do something by giving them money or presents

CHUBBY.Definition: fat, but in a pleasant way

DEALMAKERS.Definition: people who make deals and bring in new business

ELITE.Definition: the most rich and powerful (in society)

FIXER.Definition: someone who arranges for things to happen

FLAMBOYANT.Definition: very confident and noticed by other people

GAMBLE.Definition: to risk money on a game

GREED.Definition: the wish to continually get more (of something)

HUNG AROUND.Definition: to be with, be friends with

IMPLICATED.Definition: shown (that someone is involved in something)

INFRASTRUCTURE.Definition: the basic systems and structures that a country needs to work properly

INHERITED.Definition: received from someone who has died

IRONICALLY.Definition: in a strange but funny way

KICKBACKS.Definition: money that is paid back to someone, usually as a commission

LONG STORY SHORT.Definition: used when you condense the main parts of a story

MODEL.Definition: not a full, real version of something else

NICHE.Definition: a job that is very suitable for someone

OFFSHORE.Definition: in countries that are typically islands, where there is a lower tax rate

PAYOUT.Definition: an amount of money that is paid (as compensation)

PENTHOUSES.Definition: expensive apartments at the top of a building

PHILANTHROPIST.Definition: someone who helps the poor and needy, normally by giving financial donations

PLAYBOY.Definition: a rich man who spends his time on leisure activities

PRESTIGIOUS.Definition: with a reputation for high quality

SHELL.Definition: (of a company) that has been formed purely for tax or organisational reasons

SUFFIX.Definition: a letter or a group of letters that are added to the end of a word
